Locking and Unlocking a Server Configuration

Locking a server configuration enables you to limit access to the server configuration while you perform administrative operations. While a server configuration is locked, only server administration commands are accepted. For any other command, such as checking out files, the Server sends a message stating that the server configuration is unavailable.

Tip: You can also lock and unlock the server from the command line using the stcmd server-mode command.

To lock or unlock a server configuration:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. If the server configuration is not already running, start it. See Starting and Stopping a Server Configuration.

  3. Select the server configuration to be locked or unlocked from the left pane. If you are using a client, you can administer remote servers only.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Lock Server icon or select Actions > Lock Server to suspend server-level operations.

    • Click the Unlock Server icon or select Actions > Unlock Server to enable server-level operations.

  5. When the confirmation message appears, click OK.
